triples.name: Network science
triples.relevance: The paper builds upon network science as the foundational platform for studying complex systems and interactions.

triples.name: Complex system
triples.relevance: Complex systems are the primary application domain for higher-order networks discussed in the paper.

triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Hypergraphs are a mathematical structure underlying higher-order networks where edges connect multiple nodes.

triples.name: Synchronization
triples.relevance: Synchronization phenomena on networks are one of the key dynamical processes reviewed in the paper.

triples.name: Social contagion
triples.relevance: Contagion processes are dynamical processes on networks studied in the context of group interactions.

triples.name: Co-operation (evolution)
triples.relevance: Evolution of cooperation is one of the key dynamical processes on networks covered in the review.

triples.name: Consensus dynamics
triples.relevance: Consensus formation is a core dynamical process studied on higher-order networks in multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Simplicial complex
triples.relevance: Simplicial complexes are a key mathematical structure used to represent higher-order relationships in networks.

triples.name: Graph theory
triples.relevance: Graph theory provides the mathematical foundation for network science and is extended to higher-order networks.
